metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6053 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The rfbProcessClientNormalMessage function in libvncserver/rfbserver.c inLibVNCServer 0.9.9 and earlier does not properly handle attempts to send alarge amount of ClientCutText data, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (memory consumption or daemon crash) via a craftedmessage that is processed by using a single unchecked malloc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vino - 3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vino package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
italc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1').
